answers.answer: well at least u get to see your baby more soon this will all be over..good luck

I have gestational diabetes as well.  Its not as i thought it would be.  as long as you can keep your levels undercontrol it should be ok for you and your baby.  good luck if your need help let me know.
Oh, I'm so sorry you're having to face all of that.  I hope everything gets better.
Life is set to try is isnt it by throwing all sorts of unpleasent things our way! Pregnancy is stressfull enough let alone without having gestational diabetes. Hope all goes ok and keep your chin up
Oh Im sorry.. Hope you have a better day today!
Thanks everyone!Skylynns_mom - They gave me a sample menu to look at, but that's pretty much all of the info that they gave me.  If you have any other info, that would be great!
It will be over before you know it! And gestational diabetes doesn't mean you'll get regular diabetes.

question: Hi everyone.  Just an update on me.  I'm 29 weeks.  Had a dr's appointment yesterday to get results of bloodwork and my glucose test.  I have gestational diabetes.  My blood pressure is also still rising (160-90 yesterday).  I also have low potassium and elevated creatine.  He gave me a prescription for potassium and now I have to monitor blood sugar and blood pressure at home and be on a diabetic diet.  I also have to see him once a week now.  On the plus side, I do get to have more ultrasounds now, and the baby looked fine yesterday.  She's measuring about 5 days ahead, but everything else was perfectly normal.  :)  But all in all, not a good day yesterday.  Not really a question, just looking to vent and for a little support.  Thanks for listening!
title: Bad Dr's Appt
